document.docAuthor: Olmi, Massimo, Copeland, Robert S. & Noort, Simon Van
document.masterDocTitle: Dryinidae of the Afrotropical region (Hymenoptera, Chrysidoidea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Dryinidae of the Afrotropical region (Hymenoptera, Chrysidoidea)

paragraph.subSubSection:
883; Olmi & Copeland, 2011: 192 ;
Guglielmino et al . 2013: 79–81
; Olmi et al . 2015: 337; 2016: 50.
Description . ♀ ( Fig. 16F ). Fully winged; body length 1.8–1.9 mm . Head black, except mandible testaceous (occa- sionally clypeus white; occasionally frons partly white; in specimen from Botswana , Serowe, head completely whit- ish, except one brown ocellar spot); antenna brown, except antennomeres 1–3 testaceous; mesosoma and metasoma black (in specimen from Kenya , 3.47908°S 38.34162°E , mesoscutum partly ferruginous); legs testaceous. Antenna clavate; antennomeres in following proportions: 4:4:5:6:5.5:5:5:5:5:8. Head dull, granulate; frontal line incomplete; occipital carina complete; POL = 6.5; OL = 4; OOL = 3.5; OPL = 3; TL = 3. Mesoscutum dull, granulate. Notauli absent, or very short and only visible near anterior margin of mesoscutum. Mesoscutellum and metanotum shiny, unsculptured or very slightly granulate; occasionally mesoscutellum and metanotum dull and distinctly granulate. Metapectal-propodeal disc reticulate rugose, with wide areolae, usually with strong transverse posterior keel; propodeal declivity with two longitudinal keels and median area dull and completely reticulate rugose or with smooth central area. Forewing hyaline, without dark transverse bands; 2r-rs&Rs vein regularly curved. Tibial spurs 1/1/2.
♂ ( Fig. 16E ). Fully winged; body length 1.2–1.6 mm . Head black, except mandible testaceous (occasionally clyp- eus brown-testaceous or whitish; occasionally frons partly white); antenna brown, except scape and pedicel testaceous; mesosoma and metasoma black; legs testaceous. Antenna filiform; antennomeres in following proportions: 3:3:4:5:6:7:6.5:7:6:10. Head dull, granulate; frontal line absent; occipital carina complete; POL = 6; OL = 3; OOL = 4; OPL = 0.5; TL = 2. Mesoscutum , mesoscutellum and metanotum dull, granulate. Notauli absent, or very short and only visible near anterior margin of mesoscutum. Metapectal-propodeal disc reticulate rugose, with transverse posterior keel; propodeal declivity with two longitudinal keels, median area dull or shiny, reticulate rugose or granulate, lateral areas granulate, usually not reticulate rugose. Forewing hyaline, without dark transverse bands; 2r-rs& Rs vein long and regularly curved. Basivolsella ( Fig. 12E ) usually with two subdistal bristles (in specimen from Yemen , Al Kadan , left basivolsella with one subdistal bristle, right basivolsella with two subdistal bristles; specimens from Mozambique , Cuamba , with one subdistal bristle; specimen from South Africa , 34°02’S 18°23.5’E and 32°57’817’’S 18°06’837’E, with one subdistal bristle; in one specimen from South Africa , Pretoria , with two subdistal bristles on lefth basivolsella and three subdistal bristles on right basivolsella; in one specimen from South Africa , 34°27.41’S 19°21.39’E , both basivolsellae with one subdistal bristle). Tibial spurs 1/1/2.

subSubSection.paragraph:

Hosts . Typhlocybinae ( Cicadellidae ) (
Guglielmino et al . 2013
): in Mozambique :
Empoascanara ethiopica Dworakowska
and
Molopopterus alfa Dworakowska
; in Nigeria :
Empoasca
sp.

Distribution . Botswana , Burundi , Cameroon , Central African Republic , Democratic Republic of the Congo , Ethiopia , Gambia , Ivory Coast , Kenya , Madagascar , Mozambique , Nigeria , Senegal , Sierra Leone , Somalia , South Africa , Tanzania , Uganda , Zimbabwe , Yemen .
